results.name: Triangular array T of numbers generated by these rules: 1 is in T; and if x is in T, then 2x+1 and 3x+2 are in T.
comment: To obtain row n from row n-1, apply 2x+1 to each x in row n-1 and then put -1+2*3^n at the end. Or, instead, apply 3x+2 to each x in row n-1 and then put -1+2^(n+1) at the beginning.
Subtriangle of the triangle in A230445. - _Philippe Deléham_, Oct 31 2013
link: Michel Marcus, Rows n=0..99 of triangle, flattened
program: (PARI) tabl(nn) = {my(row = [1], nrow); for (n=1, nn, print (row); nrow = vector(n+1, k, if (k<=n, (2*row[k]+1), -1+2*3^n)); row = nrow;);} \\ _Michel Marcus_, Nov 14 2020
